website_summaries.verdict: A solid, durable glove for the price, although for grip purposes you may wish to consider getting a second to switch out halfway through the round.
pros: A long-lasting option that largely offers a good grip
cons: Some buyers report issues with the quality, particularly with the thin leather ripping
Grip doesn't hold up well through an entire round of golf

customer_reviews.title: Most of the reviews are great so I must have got a bad batch
customer_reviews.text: Most of the reviews are great so I must have got a bad batch. The fingers are freakishly long to the point that they are unwearable. I tried to return them but they are "ineligible for return." So I guess I'm gonna have to try and sell them to E.T
customer_reviews.author: mike farina

customer_reviews.title: Don't wash
customer_reviews.text: I used this glove regularly (daily) for Pickleball. I was pleased with the sizing, grip, etc. But my wife thought she would do me a favor and wash it. The result is a shriveled mess - not usable. Perhaps the long-lost care instructions said it was not washable. And, I suppose, the price is low enough that I should just get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: HilltownRoots

customer_reviews.title: The only glove I will purchase from here out. PERIOD!!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! AWESOME! AWESOME! I play about 3 rounds a week weather permitting with an 11 handicap. My swing speed is just over 100 mph, which I'll admit tends to be too much effort at times, but whatever. With that said I tend to go through a glove about once every 4-6 weeks, over the last year I've really tried finding cheap/bulk deals for quality gloves online (amazon,golf galaxy,etc...) no where could I find a consistent source for inexpensive quality gloves in my size. I finally tried the DynaGrip golf glove and I love it. This glove has already lasted my over a month and don't plan on replacing for another couple weeks. BUY IT, TRY IT, LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: STIXY9

customer_reviews.title: Size varies from glove to glovr. No consistency.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these gloves and they all fit differently. This last one was too small. Did not fit my hand. Can not wear. I have it away. One was too big. One was about right. Quality control seems to be a problem. Will not bother again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Best Glove I've Found
customer_reviews.text: My choice of MG was due to finding one on the course last season that had oviously been used for a good number of rounds. I used that MG all that season and its quality and durability has continued to hold up exceptionally well this season. I play once a week about 40 weeks each year, here in hot, and humid South Carolina, and even after many rounds, and frequent washing, the MG glove is still very playable. Where other brands tend to fail at the palm pad for me, the MG shows little sign of giving up yet. MG will be my choice going forward due to quality, durability and price.
customer_reviews.author: D, Charleston SC

customer_reviews.title: Rip! Tear! Aww...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try this cheap glove and was hoping it would work. Quite comfortable and good fit. But it ripped practically in half after one round and half a practice session (and I only hit about 50 balls at a time). I think the seams are just very shoddy. I've never torn a glove before. This one practically disintegrated. It tore along the entire outside of the hand, all up and down the pinky seam. There may be good cheaper leather gloves out there, but this one ain't it! Back to the big name companies for me.
customer_reviews.author: dan cohen

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the leather feels good and the glove fits well and it seems like ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the leather feels good and the glove fits well and it seems like a good value. I've only used it on two rounds so far, so I can't speak about its durability. My issue is that the stitching on the inside tip of the index finger gets under my fingernail, which can be a bit annoying. Also, with the glove being all leather, there isn't much venting built into this glove, just holes in the fingers, so it could get hot during a mid-summer round.
customer_reviews.author: Tong Po

customer_reviews.title: Soft Material, but baggy fingers
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear a size M golf glove (Nike, FootJoy, etc). I ordered a size medium to try these out, since the price seemed quite nice for an all cabretta leather glove. The palm region of the glove fit nicely and the material felt pretty nice and soft. However, the fingers were all quite baggy. (some of the pictures in the reviews highlight this)
customer_reviews.author: DJH

customer_reviews.title: Good golf gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These golf gloves are very comfortable, soft and fit right. The only issue I found is that if you are the golfer that hold tightly the club, it might break easily on the palm of the hand. I found a workaround by sticking a little piece of bandage tape on the palm of the hand where it shows the tear and with that they last really a long time. They are inexpensive but you need to add the tape cost to it.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Falcon

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: Great glove for the value. As with any premium glove, dont let yourself sweat through the glove. If you are diligent about taking your glove off between shots then this glove will last. Comparable to a Titlesit premium glove but of a little less quality. For $8 I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley D Brooks

customer_reviews.title: runs large but no returns
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a M/L, my usual size glove, and while the quality seem fine, this MG DynaGrip glove runs a lot larger than my usual Callaway Dawn Patrol. The Dynagrip glove was 1/4-3/8 inches longer in each of the fingers, and in the thumb. In addition, the fingers were wider compared to the Dawn Patrol. This wouldn't be so bad if the seller allowed exchanges for trying a different size, but there are no returns allowed, so it gets expensive to find what your actual size is in this ill-fitting glove.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing durability - didn’t last 4 rounds
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try the MG glove after the great reviews from others. This glove unfortunately fell apart after less than 4 rounds of golf. There’s a hole in the thumb and the material, which started as supple & soft, has turned to a plastic feel. I would suggest spending a few more bucks on a better glove. My Srixon glove was just $5 more than this one and has lasted well over 10 rounds.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Polin

customer_reviews.title: Great glove especially at this price
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this glove. I have played 5 or 6 rounds so far and it is just now starting to wear but will probably get 3 or 4 more out of it before it wears thru. This glove is not as polished as the titleist players glove that I usually wear but it is well made. It feels like the leather is a little thicker. The only thing I don't care for is the OMG logo on the back but for less than half price not a big deal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 of these gloves. The first ripped along a seam on the thumb within a few rounds. The second tore through the leather of the palm side of the index finger within 3 rounds. I am 70 years old and not a hard swinger. Generally only drive the ball about 200 yds so a glove should be able to hold up. Save your money
customer_reviews.author: S Clark

customer_reviews.title: I'll absolutely order more.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the MG gloves when our local shopping Costco store didn't bring in golf gloves this year and started wearing two gloves vice one. I haven't worn a glove out yet but will soon retire the first set for having gotten disgustingly dirty. That's a real testimonial to the quality of these affordable gloves. I'll absolutely order more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Fritz

customer_reviews.title: FITS AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy multiple units because I practice more than I play and the glove gets used. Having a back up in the bag is always a good idea. Fit me well. Item was delivered quickly and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: wyman2004

customer_reviews.title: Deal of the Day
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this glove. The price is Great, the fit is Great, the feel is Great. They are every bit as good as FootJoys or other brand named calbretta gloves. The only drawback I have is; there are no deals allowing you to order a dozen at a better shipping price.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best Glove Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but this is absolutely the best glove I have ever bought, hands down. I've played around 20 rounds and there is no wear. I usually wear out a glove around that many rounds on the bottom of palm, but this glove show NO wear. I fits perfectly and has stayed that way.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Best glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect when I ordered this glove for such a reasonable price. This is now the only glove I buy. It's as soft as any premier level leather glove and still very durable, lasting many many rounds
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: excellent price but do not hold up over time
customer_reviews.text: These are great practice gloves and depending on your usage, do not hold up when compared to traditional brand gloves. However, well worth it for the price and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I need to buy more, I go thru golf gloves and these are surprisingly well made compared to the usual brands of gloves. Comfy, the material is tough but supple and I can still get a “feel” for the golf club. Buy their gloves! Very good value For the money
customer_reviews.author: ALEX C.

customer_reviews.title: Ripped halfway thru first round. I managed to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Ripped halfway thru first round. I managed to get thru all 18 but it was in the trash after that. It ripped up by wrist while removing glove.
customer_reviews.author: Ragz

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove...Better Prices
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic glove. All cabretta, fits excellently, and lasted me all season, and I don't doubt that it will last into this season. No frills with design, but lets be real, it's an all cabretta glove. What more do you need?
customer_reviews.author: Nate T.

customer_reviews.title: Best value EVER.
customer_reviews.text: A glove that cannot be beaten for $6.99 shipped. Have hit the range about six times and played two rounds with it and I can just see it beginning to wear now. Fit ever so slightly bigger than say a standard Nike or footjoy glove. However, it does not run big enough to warrant sizing down, in my opinion. To make this ven better, it has a little ball marker that snaps right onto the wrist, a feature I overlooked! The marker fits very snugly into the snap and really made this glove for me. Definitely check this out!
customer_reviews.author: Blaine S.

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Delivery took longer than I would have liked, but gloves arrived well packed and intact. The gloves fit well and seem well made. To early to rate durability.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J. Salzman

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, will definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality gloves. I live in the humid Gulf Coast area and will use 5 gloves in a round - these gloves stay tacky for quite a while and regain their tackiness after they dry for my next round. I've used the gloves now for about 10 rounds and no signs of wear yet. Once I do wear these out, I will definitely purchase again. The glove fits as advertised, at least the medium gloves do.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Corey

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are like having a second skin on your hand. They provide protection, and good grip when grasping a golf club. The good design provides comfort and good looks.
customer_reviews.author: hyojun

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think I would like this glove much as a "no-name" (to me) brand
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think I would like this glove much as a "no-name" (to me) brand. However, it's pretty comfortable and has held up much better than several Taylormade, Callaway, and Nike gloves that I have had before it. No holes and very little stretch (if any) after about 10 rounds of golf with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R. Nickell

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are awesome, I have bought 3 as of today. They do wear out, just like any glove would wear out. For sizing.... they fit within the same parameters as a FootJoy glove, just a lot cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gloves
customer_reviews.text: Excellent leather golf gloves, especially for the price. As far as I am concerned they are every bit as good as the name breand models. Just as well fitting and comfortable as well as long lasting and about half the money.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT CLENDANIEL

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality leather, but....
customer_reviews.text: The seam on the thumb of this glove runs right down the center of the thumb instead of on the side. Already causing a callous on my thumb. Not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JamieT22

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: This glove was very soft and beautiful but the sizing is off. I ordered a women's small and it fit more like a medium. If your ring size is 6-7, I wouldn't recommend this brand. Also, the leather stretches alot so now the fingers are larger than before.
customer_reviews.author: MsKing27

customer_reviews.title: Truly decent glove
customer_reviews.text: This product is as advertised; comfortable, durable and almost as good as more expensive gloves. Out of the box the glove feels a little stiff but the leather quickly breaks in. The fit is not perfect, but not too bad. And the glove looks good with a simple, smart logo. I will continue to buy TM and Titleist gloves for competitive rounds, but I will buy more MG gloves as well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gavigan

customer_reviews.title: Mine have lasted over 40 rounds!
customer_reviews.text: This has become my glove! I have other brands still in the packages but once I used these have never wanted to use the others. I find most comfortable glove and lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Sievert

customer_reviews.title: Unable to return
customer_reviews.text: Did not appreciate finding out that these are unreturnable. I inadvertently changed the order before submitting it to the wrong hand. Make certain that you know your size. Have ordered these before and they are a good value and well made.
customer_reviews.author: marc meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great glove at a great value
customer_reviews.text: I got this glove a month and a half ago. Since then, I have played 10-12 rounds and have been on the driving range about 20 times. The glove fits nicely and is holding up as well as, if not better than, those I have bought for more than twice the price. When not in use, it is kept in a Zip-loc bag to keep it from drying out. I am very satisfied with this purchase and will buy more as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gifford

customer_reviews.title: While the leather seems nice, compared to nicer golf gloves it's thicker and ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the cadet size after the fingers felt tight and long on this glove. The glove I purchased had some threads come loose around the junction of the thumb and palm. So I'm not sure about the quality of these. While the leather seems nice, compared to nicer golf gloves it's thicker and not as soft.
customer_reviews.author: Y2KrazyKarl

customer_reviews.title: Not a positive experience
customer_reviews.text: Started off good but a little rain and the glove started coming apart. The outer layer is something different and will shift from the inner of the glove. Didn’t expect much but this only lasted 3 rounds.
customer_reviews.author: mk

customer_reviews.title: Have used these gloves for years
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are soft and very easy to wear can feel your grip and no need to over squeeze, Last for many rounds and never stiffen up, they stay soft and playable . Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no longevity!
customer_reviews.text: I play approximately 100+ rounds a year and that doesn’t include all the range time I enjoy as well, so buying 22 dollar golf gloves tend to get expensive, so I have been looking for a cheaper alternative. The photo attached shows one round of golf that I shot a 78 and 90 range balls on 2 separate days. The glove just deteriorated over that time. I was really hoping for much better but I will never purchase this glove again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve giffin

customer_reviews.title: Looks good we will see if it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good quality. It only has a single piece of leather in the palm. So with that in mind we will see about the longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. DeVenney

customer_reviews.title: OK Glove
customer_reviews.text: Lesser quality leather. It will let for several rounds, but not very long lasting. Seems a bit thinner than most gloves I have been wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Gintoft

customer_reviews.title: great glove for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel and softness of the glove and I use it to play GOLF or at least try.
customer_reviews.author: goodboy

customer_reviews.title: What a comfortable glove!
customer_reviews.text: I wear this glove every time I play. So far, no evident wear. The comfort is superb
customer_reviews.author: Walter D. Eichensehr

customer_reviews.title: All LEATHER golf gloves at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find all leather golf gloves at a cheap price but this company does both! Very happy with quality and fit of a their gloves. I noticed that the price has gone up on Amazon but, the company sent me a email offering up to 5 pairs of gloves for the same price I originally bought it for and any size I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: D.M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: The leather was very nice, which is the only reason it doesn't get ...
customer_reviews.text: The leather was very nice, which is the only reason it doesn't get only 1 star. The fit was horrendous. It felt like an extra baggy pair of pants...but for my hand. The issue had nothing to do with glove size, as it was the right fit for my hand. Could not even play a single round with it.
customer_reviews.author: R Escobar

customer_reviews.title: After about an hour of hitting balls – the gloves ripped all the way across to my hand.
customer_reviews.text: They look beautiful – but the one I ordered llasted only one practice round at the driving range.. After about an hour of hitting balls – the glove ripped all the way across my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Nice glovr
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, and last a little longer than other gloves at a better price
customer_reviews.author: sirtaper

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. Better glove than ones that cost twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Sew Shoot Me

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Threw it away after 4 rounds. Starting losing serious grip in round 3. I do play in humid weather so the sweat/dirt probably didn't help even though I take it off after every shot and don't use it from about 115 and in. I usually just wear a FJ rain glove for all practice/practice rounds. I would use the cheap price to buy more in bulk. Pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: GOLF GLIVES THAT FIT!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find golf gloves that fit my husband's large hands so perfectly and these do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer  Chris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap glove
customer_reviews.text: Should have known better to buy this cheap glove! A large is a XXL and fits like an XXL
customer_reviews.author: DAN

customer_reviews.title: MG Golf DynaGrip All-Cabretta Leather Golf Glove
customer_reviews.text: The glove feels nice and comfortable. Grips nicely. Great glove.
customer_reviews.author: Allen J Crossley

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove-Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Gloves are comfortable, durable, and provide a good grip. I have used them in the past and have always been satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: I am very hard on golf gloves..an average person would get longer life than me....I found these gloves to be very comfortable...and long lasting....I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice glove it's thin enough that you can still feel the club in your hand ,, and for the price a nice buy,, I didn't give it 5 stars because I don't know how it will hold up after used
customer_reviews.author: RAYMOND C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel
customer_reviews.text: nothing to dislike great feel great price ...might even help my scores ( but doubt it lol)
customer_reviews.author: stephano

customer_reviews.title: OK deal for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Good price and the fit is good and the Glove seems to wear well but the Glove definitely dries out too fast and then I loose the tackiness. After just 2 rounds I seem to constantly having to wet down the glove in order to keep the tackiness - Probably will stick to the Callaway/Costco Golf Glove
customer_reviews.author: Robert Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Great glove!
customer_reviews.text: Fits and feels great . Love the price and will be buying again. Long lasting and comfortable golf glove.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are excellent and are a steal for the price
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are excellent and are a steal for the price. I sized myself using Footjoy's sizing information and somewhat surprisingly was sized as a small. I bought these in a small size, and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Collins

customer_reviews.title: MG Golf DynaGrip All Cabretta Leather Golf Glove
customer_reviews.text: When I wear this glove I feel like a cotton touching my hand. Nice size. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ottoniel L.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific leather glove at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Terrific leather glove at an excellent price! Fits well and wears well. I will always buy this glove in the future. I have two buddies who have been buying these gloves for two years and they recommended them to me. I'll be forever grateful to them..
customer_reviews.author: BrianK

customer_reviews.title: MG may stand for Mighty Good
customer_reviews.text: Not the big name brand with the big price. These quality gloves perform no worse than the best big name brand glove.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Queen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Glove
customer_reviews.text: The leather is so soft. The stitching and fitting is really excellent. At this price it is a great buy. I would recommend it fully. It is so much better than whet I expected. My thanks to MG golf for making such a great leather glove at this price. I can't comment on the wear and tear as I have just opened the package.
customer_reviews.author: TS Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This glove fits better and lasts longer than gloves twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: This glove isn't strong enough to last half a season without the thumbs wearing out...don't buy..
customer_reviews.author: Soldier 1

customer_reviews.title: Best glove for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I play in Savannah. Hot and humid. I play 27 holes per week on average and go thru 1 glove every 3 rounds due to sweat. These glove are as good as the footjoy $17 gloves I usually buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy one of these and save some money
customer_reviews.text: Feels like incredibly good quality. Fits and feels identical to a Titleist.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler D

customer_reviews.title: Get a Grip!
customer_reviews.text: These are all leather golf gloves. There are more expensive gloves, but these work great, and are reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Deibel

customer_reviews.title: good gloves, these are very fine leather and quite ...
customer_reviews.text: good gloves, these are very fine leather and quite tough. I've played several rounds and they hold together real nice. Very soft feel, good quality. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Shubert

customer_reviews.title: Stretched out too soon
customer_reviews.text: Started out good, but stretched out after only a few rounds. I picked up a Wilson glove that seems to be staying more snug for longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves...hold up very well
customer_reviews.text: Why buy other brands of gloves? These are simply the best, and are priced well too
customer_reviews.author: JDB

customer_reviews.title: True Cabretta Leather, well constructed....and inexpensive!!
customer_reviews.text: I play 1-2 times per week and very sick of paying $20 for a good “players glove” that seems to wear out or rip In no time. Gave these a shot as I know mg golf makes some quality products and I could not be happier. Feels like the best and most pricey gloves on the market and has to ripped or shown signs of wear and tear after 2 rounds.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Selvey

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased roughly 8-10 of these gloves in the past, always the same size, usually very similar fit. Unfortunately this most recent glove does not fit and appears to be made a full 1-2 sizes too big. I certainly enjoyed the gloves I had previously for the price point they were great, but not worth the risk anymore moving forward knowing I can get a glove I’ll never be able to wear and play comfortably
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves for women. The women's sizes have a shorter thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Mouse

customer_reviews.title: You cannot beat this glove!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat this glove! I buy several and rotate them during my round in the summer when it’s hot and humid. The leather is soft and pliable and the fit is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Powerful Living Int'l

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly great glove. Already got more than a few rounds out of it. It’s on par with the Titleist gloves I used to use, but these are a few bucks cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Non returnable be advised
customer_reviews.text: Be careful this item is non returnable. Bought it in error and cannot return it. Unfortunately I am going to base my review on the fact that I cannot return this item. When purchasing items that are non refundable there should be a pop up to let us know.
customer_reviews.author: simon mitrev

customer_reviews.title: Price is right
customer_reviews.text: Glove is okay but tends to get a little stiff over time you can’t leave it in your bag
customer_reviews.author: DILLY DILLYAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2-3 Rounds Only
customer_reviews.text: Glove feels great and fits as expected but only lasts about 2-3 rounds.
customer_reviews.author: Keegan Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Overall definitely better than average cheap gloves
customer_reviews.text: Overall definitely better than average cheap gloves. The leather is soft and durable but it does not provide the AAA cabretta type grip or durability over time. I use these it for practice and they get put to a severe test. Overall not bad for the money.
customer_reviews.author: LA ShopperTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the gloves. It's been a log time since I've had all real leather gloves. I forgot that they tend to stretch. I'd recommend getting a size smaller than usual though. Oh, and they were delivered earlier than promised
customer_reviews.author: milt

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, subject to wear
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and nice construction but wore a hole in the glove within a couple of rounds. Actually it indicated I was letting the club ride too far up my hand. I changed my grip as a result and am striking to ball better now! I'll try again with the grip change.
customer_reviews.author: Golferguy

customer_reviews.title: Nice look and good feel though size seems to run ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice look and good feel though size seems to run a little smaller than normal. Should have ordered a med/lg which was an option. Will know better the next time. Also thought the glove had a ball mark on them based on the photo but not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove! Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT GLOVE!! AWESOME PRICE!! one of the most comfortable gloves ive ever bought at an extremely fair price, and i didnt even have to drive anywhere to get it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on the first swing.
customer_reviews.text: Seam on my middle finger ripped on the first swing. Super annoying that the glove ripped that fast and they offer no return option. It’s pretty frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Nice Glove
customer_reviews.text: I have two rounds in high-humidity weather in the 80's and it's holding up amazingly well. Good fit, good quality product. It may be one rung down from a Sta-Soft Footjoy that sells for $25 or so but for the money, a real good buy! Yes, this is real cabretta leather, not synthetic.
customer_reviews.author: St Louie Dan

customer_reviews.title: No ball marker
customer_reviews.text: Think it needs a ball marker like other similar gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Tarheel

customer_reviews.title: The size was correct for my hand but the overall fit wasn't good.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't fit well. The size was correct for my hand but the overall fit wasn't good.
customer_reviews.author: Traviscf

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping I would love this product
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping I would love this product. I can't say I love it. This glove stretches when it gets worn in. If I were to buy again, which I won't, I would size down so that when it stretches it fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Watson

customer_reviews.title: Buy 1 size larger
customer_reviews.text: Glove looks and feels great, but buy a size larger. I'm a typical m/l and their m/l is too small. I had to buy the L which fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sands

customer_reviews.title: Good value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Glove held up as good as a $20 footjoy. I'll continue to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Burke

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent golf glove for the price. I have bought many over the years. I highly recommend this product. I saw one of the pro’s wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Philpott

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after two rounds of golf. Not worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is true value
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, the best glove I have ever had and what makes it great is the price. I have played several other cabretta leather gloves and these match them and last longer. I have order 2 already, second one is in the bag. First one I am still wearing from April. This is true value in a very expensive sport.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas D.

customer_reviews.title: but I really like them. I'm picky about gloves
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on these (you never know how they'll fit), but I really like them. I'm picky about gloves, and these feel as good as any higher-priced gloves. They seem to last fine for me - no complaints there. Can't beat this for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Robert S Nipp

customer_reviews.title: It is a very nice glove for the price but still wanted the one ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the glove with the attached ball marker but did not receive it. I instead received the glove without the marker. It is a very nice glove for the price but still wanted the one with the ball marker attached.
customer_reviews.author: sternbul

customer_reviews.title: Golf glove
customer_reviews.text: Just got them. seem comfortable. a friend highly recommends them.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly enough. They really are good.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great! Super high quality. Has lasted 10 large buckets and 4-5 rounds and still has a ton of life. But i do rotate gloves every 2-3 holes. I wear med-large in all other brands but wanted to get a medium in this and it was tight but the correct fit.
customer_reviews.author: mstrymxer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible glove Ripped apart in 1 second.
customer_reviews.text: opened up the package and as soon as I began to try it on the the glove ripped apart.
customer_reviews.author: Scwine

product_meta.title: MG Golf Glove Mens DynaGrip All-Cabretta Leather (Regular Sizes)
feature_bullets: Quality and traditional styling comparable to FootJoy Sta-Sof
Winner of several PGA Tour events
